alert.note: Alert for Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 18 at 2:44PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream and creek flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Northern Maine, including the following county, Aroostook. * WHEN...Until 430 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and creeks. Water over low crossing roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 234 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause small stream and creek flooding. Rapid river rises will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lac Frontiere and Nine-mile Bridge. - This include Depot Road, Number 1 Road, Realty Road, and other logging roads along Depot Stream south of Big Black River. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
